SEARCH
Package SC2002.Project.entity

Class BTOApplication

java.lang.Object
SC2002.Project.entity.BTOApplication
public class BTOApplication extends Object
Represents a Build‑To‑Order (BTO) application submitted by an Applicant.

This class manages the lifecycle of a BTO application including:

  • Initial application submission
  • Status transitions (pending → success/rejected/withdrawn)
  • Booking requests and flat selection
  • Withdrawal requests and processing

The application status follows this progression:

  • PENDING: Initial state upon submission, awaiting manager decision
  • SUCCESS: Application approved, waiting for booking
  • BOOKED: Flat successfully selected and booked
  • REJECTED: Application denied by manager
  • WITHDRAWN: Application withdrawn by applicant

Fulfills the following requirements:

  • Tracks application status from submission through approval/rejection
  • Supports flat booking for successful applications
  • Supports application withdrawal at any stage
  • Maintains history of status changes with timestamps
  • Links applicants to their selected projects and flat types

  • Constructor Details

    • BTOApplication

      public BTOApplication(Applicant applicant, Project project, String roomType)
      Creates a new BTOApplication with an auto-generated ID. Initial status is PENDING, and timestamp is set to current time.
      Parameters:
      applicant - The applicant submitting the application
      project - The project being applied for
      roomType - The type of flat being requested (e.g., "2-ROOM")

    • BTOApplication

      public BTOApplication(int id, Applicant applicant, Project project, String roomType)
      Creates a BTOApplication with a specified ID (used for loading from snapshot). This constructor allows the system to recreate applications with specific IDs when loading from saved data.
      Parameters:
      id - The specific ID to assign to this application
      applicant - The applicant submitting the application
      project - The project being applied for
      roomType - The type of flat being requested (e.g., "2-ROOM")

      public int getId()
      Gets the unique ID of this application.
      Returns:
      The application's ID

      Returns:
      The room type (e.g., "2-ROOM", "3-ROOM")

    • getStatus

      public ApplicationStatus getStatus()
      Gets the current status of this application.
      Returns:
      The application status

    • isWithdrawalRequested

      public boolean isWithdrawalRequested()
      Checks if withdrawal has been requested for this application.
      Returns:
      True if withdrawal is requested, false otherwise

    • isBookingRequested

      public boolean isBookingRequested()
      Checks if booking has been requested for this application.
      Returns:
      True if booking is requested, false otherwise

    • getBookedFlat

      public Flat getBookedFlat()
      Gets the flat that has been booked for this application (if any).
      Returns:
      The booked flat, or null if no flat is booked

    • getSubmissionDate

      public LocalDateTime getSubmissionDate()
      Gets the date and time when this application was submitted.
      Returns:
      The submission timestamp

    • getLastUpdateDate

      public LocalDateTime getLastUpdateDate()
      Gets the date and time when this application was last updated.
      Returns:
      The last update timestamp

    • getManager

      public HDB_Manager getManager()
      Gets the HDB manager associated with this application.
      Returns:
      The HDB manager assigned to handle this application, or null if none assigned

    • setStatus

      public void setStatus(ApplicationStatus newStatus)
      Package‑private status setter (for controllers). Updates the lastUpdateDate to track when the status changed.
      Parameters:
      newStatus - The new status to set

    • setWithdrawalRequested

      public void setWithdrawalRequested(boolean flag)
      Allows manager/UI to clear the withdrawal flag (e.g. on reject).
      Parameters:
      flag - The new value for the withdrawal requested flag

    • setBookingRequested

      public void setBookingRequested(boolean flag)
      Allows manual clearing of the bookingRequested flag if needed.
      Parameters:
      flag - The new value for the booking requested flag

    • setManager

      public void setManager(HDB_Manager manager)
      Sets the HDB manager responsible for handling this application.
      Parameters:
      manager - The HDB manager to assign to this application

    • setBookedFlat

      public void setBookedFlat(Flat flat)
      Package-private method to set the booked flat directly. This is used during cancellation or rejection of bookings.
      Parameters:
      flat - The flat to set (or null to clear booking)

    • requestWithdrawal

      public void requestWithdrawal()
      Applicant requests withdrawal (sets withdrawal flag). Fulfills the requirement that applicants can request withdrawal before/after flat booking. Allowed for all statuses except REJECTED or WITHDRAWN.

    • confirmWithdrawal

      public void confirmWithdrawal()
      Manager confirms a withdrawal request. Fulfills the requirement that managers can approve withdrawal requests. If a flat was booked, it is released and made available again.

    • approve

      public void approve()
      Manager approves the application. Fulfills the requirement that managers can approve applications. Only allowed if application is in PENDING status.

    • reject

      public void reject()
      Manager rejects the application. Fulfills the requirement that managers can reject applications. If application is in BOOKED status, cancels the booking first.

    • requestBooking

      public void requestBooking()
      Applicant requests a booking after approval. Sets a flag that the applicant wants to book a flat. Only allowed if application is in SUCCESS status and booking not already requested.

    • bookFlat

      public void bookFlat(Flat flat)
      Books a flat for this application. Sets the status to BOOKED if the current status is SUCCESS. No need to update project's available units as this was already handled during manager approval.
      Parameters:
      flat - The flat to book

    • cancelBooking

      public boolean cancelBooking()
      Cancels a booked flat and reverts status, re‑increments units. This method is used when an application's booking needs to be cancelled, such as during withdrawal or when a project/flat type is deleted.
      Returns:
      True if booking was successfully canceled, false otherwise

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the application.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      A string with application details
